trans-unit.source: Vidalia was unable to connect to Tor. (%1)
Socket disconnected while attempting to read a line of data.
The Tor service is not installed.
Unable to start the Tor service.
Changes the transparency of the Bandwidth Graph
'%1' is not a valid IP address.
You selected 'Password' authentication, but did not specify a password.
%1 does not exist. Would you like to create it?
Select a Directory to Use for Tor Data
Vidalia was unable to remove the Tor service.\n\nYou may need to remove it manually.
Vidalia was unable to install the Tor service.
Start the Tor software with the specified configuration file (torrc)
Select path to your configuration file
Store data for the Tor software in the following directory
Select the directory used to store data for the Tor software
Vidalia will run with this User's permissions
Vidalia will run with this Group's permissions
Choose the language used in Vidalia
Changes to language will only take effect after restarting Vidalia!
Vidalia was unable to save your %1 settings.
Vidalia was unable to apply your %1 settings to Tor.
The proxy arguments specified are not properly formatted.
You must specify the name of your Tor executable.
Start Vidalia when my system starts
Start the Tor software when Vidalia starts
Start a proxy application when Vidalia starts
The specified bridge identifier is not valid.
You must specify both an IP address or hostname and a port number to configure Tor to use a proxy to access the Internet.
You must specify one or more ports to which your firewall allows you to connect.
'%1' is not a valid port number.
Check to only connect to relays using ports allowed by your firewall
My firewall only lets me connect to certain ports
Check to encrypt directory requests and, optionally, use bridge relays to access the Tor network
My ISP blocks connections to the Tor network
Check if your local network requires a proxy to access the Internet

The Tor software you are currently running does not support bridges.
Your directory connections will still be encrypted.
I use a proxy to access the Internet
How do I find a bridge?
Remove the selected bridges from the list
Copy the selected bridges to the clipboard
Use this proxy for HTTPS also
You have configured Tor to act as a bridge relay for censored users, but your version of Tor does not support bridges.
Please upgrade your Tor software or configure Tor to act as a normal Tor relay.
Your bridge relay is not running.
You must specify at least a relay nickname and port.
This is the identity of your bridge relay that you can give to other people
Copy your bridge relay's identity to the clipboard
Enable to mirror the relay directory
Attempt to automatically configure port forwarding
Email address at which you may be reached if there is a\nproblem with your relay. You might also include your PGP or GPG fingerprint.
Relay traffic for the Tor network
Port on which users and other relays can communicate with your relay
Help censored users reach the Tor network (Tor 0.2.0.8-alpha or newer)
For Internet connections with fast download speed but slow upload, please list your upload speed here.
Select the entry that most closely resembles your Internet connection
Show help topic on bandwidth rate limits
Your maximum bandwidth rate must be greater than or equal to your average bandwidth rate. Both values must be at least 20 KB/s.
Show help topic on exit policies
What Internet resources should users be able to access from your relay?
Let others access your bridge by giving them this line:
Error while trying to unpublish all services
Please configure at least a service directory and a virtual port for each service you want to save. Remove the other ones.
Virtual Port may only contain valid port numbers [1..65535].
Target may only contain address:port, address, or port.
Directory already in use by another service.
Copy onion address of selected service to clipboard
Browse in local file system and choose directory for selected service
Failed to hash the control password.
No valid UPnP-enabled Internet gateway devices found
Failed to add a port mapping
Failed to retrieve a port mapping
Failed to remove a port mapping
Supplied XML file is not a valid Contents document.
Search for a word or phrase on current page (Ctrl+F)
Messages that appear when something has \ngone very wrong and Tor cannot proceed.
Messages that only appear when \nsomething has gone wrong with Tor.

Messages that appear infrequently 
during normal Tor operation and are 
not considered errors, but you may 
care about.
Messages that appear frequently \nduring normal Tor operation.

Vidalia was unable to open the specified log file.

Another Vidalia process is possibly already running. If there really is not another Vidalia process running, you can choose to continue anyway.\n\nWould you like to continue starting Vidalia?
The currently installed version of Tor is out of date or no longer recommended. Please visit the Tor website to download the latest version.
All subsequent connections will appear to be different than your old connections.
Vidalia was unable to configure automatic port forwarding.
Vidalia was unable to start the configured web browser
Vidalia was unable to start the configured proxy server
Your relay is shutting down.\nClick 'Stop' again to stop your relay now.
Vidalia was unable to start Tor. Check your settings to ensure the correct name and location of your Tor executable is specified.
You are currently running a relay. Terminating your relay will interrupt any open connections from clients.\n\nWould you like to shutdown gracefully and give clients time to find a new relay?
Vidalia was unable to stop the Tor software.
Vidalia detected that the Tor software exited unexpectedly.\n\nPlease check the message log for recent warning or error messages.
The Tor software requires Vidalia to send the contents of an authentication cookie, but Vidalia was unable to find one.
Would you like to browse for the file 'control_auth_cookie' yourself?
Vidalia was unable to register for some events. Many of Vidalia's features may be unavailable.
Please enter your control password (not the hash):
Vidalia was unable to authenticate to the Tor software. (%1)
Please check your control port authentication settings.
